00018 =head1 NAME
00019 
00020 Context("Inequalities"), Context("Inequalities-Only") - Provides contexts that
00021 allow intervals to be specified as inequalities.
00022 
00023 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00024 
00025 Implements contexts that provides for inequalities that produce
00026 the cooresponding Interval, Set or Union MathObjects.  There are
00027 two such contexts:  Context("Inequalities"), in which both
00028 intervals and inequalities are defined, and Context("Inequalities-Only"),
00029 which allows only inequalities as a means of producing intervals.
00030 
00031 =head1 USAGE
00032 
00033     loadMacros("contextInequalities.pl");
00034     
00035     Context("Inequalities");
00036     $S1 = Compute("1 < x <= 4");
00037     $S2 = Inequality("(1,4]");     # force interval to be inequality
00038     
00039     Context("Inequalities-Only");
00040     $S1 = Compute("1 < x <= 4");
00041     $S2 = Inequality("(1,4]");     # generates an error
00042     
00043     $S3 = Compute("x < -2 or x > 2");  # forms the Union (-inf,-2) U (2,inf)
00044     $S4 = Compute("x > 2 and x <= 4"); # forms the Interval (2,4]
00045     $S5 = Compute("x = 1");            # forms the Set
00046     $S6 = Compute("x != 1");           # forms the Union (-inf,1) U (1,inf)
00047 
00048 You can set the "noneWord" flag to specify the string to
00049 use when the inequalities specify the empty set.  By default,
00050 it is "NONE", but you can change it to other strings.  Be sure
00051 that you use a string that is defined in the Context, however,
00052 if you expect the student to be able to enter it.  For example
00053 
00054     Context("Inequalities");
00055     Context()->constants->add(EmptySet => Set());
00056     Context()->flags->set(noneWord=>"EmptySet");
00057 
00058 creates an empty set as a named constant and uses that name.
00059 
00060 In addition to the noneWord flag, the inequality contexts accept the
00061 following additional flags:
00062 
00063 =over
00064 
00065 =item S<C<< showNotEquals >>>
00066 
00067 This controls whether intervals of the form (-inf,a) U (a,inf) are
00068 displayed as x != a or not.  The default is 1, meaning convert to
00069 x != a.
00070 
00071 =item S<C<< allowSloppyInequalities >>>
00072 
00073 This controls whether <= and >= can also be represented by =< and =>
00074 or not.  By default, both forms are allowed, to allow maximum
00075 flexibility in student answers, but if set to 0, only the first forms
00076 are allowed.
00077 
00078 =back
00079 
00080 Inequalities and interval notation both can coexist side by
00081 side, but you may wish to convert from one to the other.
00082 Use Inequality() to convert from an Interval, Set or Union
00083 to an Inequality, and use Interval(), Set(), or Union() to
00084 convert from an Inequality object to one in interval notation.
00085 For example:
00086 
00087     $I0 = Compute("(1,2]");            # the interval (1,2]
00088     $I1 = Inequality($I1);             # the inequality 1 < x <= 2
00089     
00090     $I0 = Compute("1 < x <= 2");       # the inequality 1 < x <= 2
00091     $I1 = Interval($I0);               # the interval (1,2]
00092 
00093 Note that ineqaulities and inervals can be compared and combined
00094 regardless of the format, so $I0 == $I1 is true in either example
00095 above.
00096 
00097 Since Inequality objects are actually Interval objects, the variable
00098 used to create them doesn't matter.  That is,
00099 
00100     $I0 = Compute("1 < x <= 2");
00101     $I1 = Compute("1 < y <= 2");
00102 
00103 would both produce the same interval, so $I0 == $I1 would be true in
00104 this case.  If you need to distinguish between these two, use
00105 
00106     $I0 == $I1 && $I0->{varName} eq $I1->{varName}
00107 
00108 instead.
00109 
00110 =cut
00111 
00112 loadMacros("MathObjects.pl");
00113 
00114 sub _contextInequalities_init {Inequalities::Init()}
00115 
00116 package Inequalities;
00117 
00118 #
00119 #  Sets up the two inequality contexts
00120 #
00121 sub Init {
00122   my $context = $main::context{Inequalities} = Parser::Context->getCopy("Interval");
00123   $context->{name} = "Inequalities";
00124   $context->operators->add(
00125      '<'  => {precedence => .5, associativity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => ' < ',
00126               class => 'Inequalities::BOP::inequality', eval => 'evalLessThan', combine => 1},
00127 
00128      '>'  => {precedence => .5, associativity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => ' > ',
00129               class => 'Inequalities::BOP::inequality', eval => 'evalGreaterThan', combine => 1},
00130 
00131      '<=' => {precedence => .5, associativity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => ' <= ', TeX => '\le ',
00132               class => 'Inequalities::BOP::inequality', eval => 'evalLessThanOrEqualTo', combine => 1},
00133      '=<' => {precedence => .5, associativity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => ' <= ', TeX => '\le ',
00134               class => 'Inequalities::BOP::inequality', eval => 'evalLessThanOrEqualTo', combine => 1,
00135               isSloppy => "<="},
00136 
00137      '>=' => {precedence => .5, associativity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => ' >= ', TeX => '\ge ',
00138               class => 'Inequalities::BOP::inequality', eval => 'evalGreaterThanOrEqualTo', combine => 1},
00139      '=>' => {precedence => .5, associativity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => ' >= ', TeX => '\ge ',
00140               class => 'Inequalities::BOP::inequality', eval => 'evalGreaterThanOrEqualTo', combine => 1,
00141               isSloppy => ">="},
00142 
00143      '='  => {precedence => .5, associativity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => ' = ',
00144               class => 'Inequalities::BOP::inequality', eval => 'evalEqualTo'},
00145 
00146      '!=' => {precedence => .5, associativity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => ' != ', TeX => '\ne ',
00147               class => 'Inequalities::BOP::inequality', eval => 'evalNotEqualTo'},
00148 
00149      'and' => {precedence => .45, associateivity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => " and ",
00150            TeX => '\hbox{ and }', class => 'Inequalities::BOP::and'},
00151 
00152      'or' => {precedence => .4, associateivity => 'left', type => 'bin', string => " or ",
00153           TeX => '\hbox{ or }', class => 'Inequalities::BOP::or'},
00154   );
00155   $context->operators->set(
00156      '+' => {class => "Inequalities::BOP::add"},
00157      '-' => {class => "Inequalities::BOP::subtract"},
00158   );
00159   $context->parens->set("(" => {type => "List", formInterval => ']'});  # trap these later
00160   $context->parens->set("[" => {type => "List", formInterval => ')'});  # trap these later
00161   $context->strings->remove("NONE");
00162   $context->constants->add(NONE=>Value::Set->new());
00163   $context->flags->set(
00164      noneWord => 'NONE',
00165      showNotEquals => 1,            # display (-inf,a) U (a,inf) as x != a
00166      allowSloppyInequalities => 1,  # allow =< and => as equivalent to <= and >=
00167   );
00168   $context->{parser}{Variable} = "Inequalities::Variable";
00169   $context->{value}{'Interval()'} = "Inequalities::MakeInterval";
00170   $context->{value}{Inequality} = "Inequalities::Inequality";
00171   $context->{value}{InequalityInterval} = "Inequalities::Interval";
00172   $context->{value}{InequalityUnion} = "Inequalities::Union";
00173   $context->{value}{InequalitySet} = "Inequalities::Set";
00174   $context->{value}{List} = "Inequalities::List";
00175   $context->{precedence}{Inequality} = $context->{precedence}{special};
00176   $context->lists->set(List => {class => 'Inequalities::List::List'});
00177 
00178   #
00179   #  Disable interval notation in "Inequalities-Only" context
00180   #
00181   $context = $main::context{"Inequalities-Only"} = $context->copy;
00182   $context->lists->set(
00183     Interval => {class => 'Inequalities::List::notAllowed'},
00184     Set      => {class => 'Inequalities::List::notAllowed'},
00185     Union    => {class => 'Inequalities::List::notAllowed'},
00186   );
00187   $context->operators->set('U' => {class => 'Inequalities::BOP::union'});
00188   $context->constants->remove('R');
00189 
00190   #
00191   #  Define the Inequality() constructor
00192   #
00193   main::PG_restricted_eval('sub Inequality {Value->Package("Inequality")->new(@_)}');
00194 }
00195 
00196 
00197 ##################################################
00198 #
00199 #  General BOP that handles the inequalities.
00200 #  The difference comes in the _eval() method,
00201 #  which tells what each computes.
00202 #
00203 package Inequalities::BOP::inequality;
00204 our @ISA = ("Parser::BOP");
00205 
00206 #
00207 #  Check that the inequality is formed between a variable and a number,
00208 #  or between a number and another compatible inequality.  Otherwise,
00209 #  give an error.
00210 #
00211 #  varPos and numPos tell which of lop or rop is the variable and which
00212 #  the number.  varName is the variable involved in the inequality.
00213 #
00214 sub _check {
00215   my $self = shift;
00216   $self->Error("'%s' should be written '%s'",$self->{bop},$self->{def}{isSloppy})
00217     if (!$self->context->flag("allowSloppyInequalities") && $self->{def}{isSloppy});
00218   $self->{type} = $Value::Type{interval};
00219   $self->{isInequality} = 1;
00220   ($self->{varPos},$self->{numPos}) =
00221     ($self->{lop}->class eq 'Variable' || $self->{lop}{isInequality} ? ('lop','rop') : ('rop','lop'));
00222   my ($v,$n) = ($self->{$self->{varPos}},$self->{$self->{numPos}});
00223   if (($n->isNumber || $n->{isInfinite}) && ($n->{isConstant} || scalar(keys %{$n->getVariables}) == 0)) {
00224     if ($v->class eq 'Variable') {
00225       $self->{varName} = $v->{name};
00226       delete $self->{equation}{variables}{$v->{name}} if $v->{isNew};
00227       $self->{$self->{varPos}} = Inequalities::DummyVariable->new($self->{equation},$v->{name},$v->{ref});
00228       return;
00229     }
00230     if ($self->{def}{combine} && $v->{isInequality}) {
00231       my $bop = $self->{bop}; $bop =~ s/=//; my $bope = $bop."="; my $ebop = "=".$bop;
00232       if (($v->{bop} eq $bop || $v->{bop} eq $bope || $v->{bop} eq $ebop) && $v->{varPos} eq $self->{numPos}) {
00233     $self->{varName} = $v->{varName};
00234     return;
00235       }
00236     }
00237   }
00238   $self->Error("'%s' should have a variable on one side and a number on the other",$self->{bop})
00239     unless $v->{isInequality} && $v->{varPos} eq $self->{numPos};
00240   $self->Error("'%s' can't be combined with '%s'",$v->{bop},$self->{bop});
00241 }
00242 
00243 #
00244 #  Generate the interval for the given type of inequality.
00245 #  If it is a combined inequality, intersect with the other
00246 #  one to get the final set.
00247 #
00248 sub _eval {
00249   my $self = shift; my ($a,$b) = @_;
00250   my $eval = $self->{def}{eval};
00251   my $I = $self->Package("Inequality")->new($self->context,$self->$eval(@_),$self->{varName});
00252   return $I->intersect($a) if Value::isValue($a) && $a->type eq 'Interval';
00253   return $I->intersect($b) if Value::isValue($b) && $b->type eq 'Interval';
00254   return $I;
00255 }
00256 
00257 sub evalLessThan {
00258   my ($self,$a,$b) = @_; my $context = $self->context;
00259   my $I = Value::Infinity->new($context);
00260   return $self->Package("Interval")->new($context,'(',-$I,$b,')') if $self->{varPos} eq 'lop';
00261   return $self->Package("Interval")->new($context,'(',$a,$I,')');
00262 }
00263 
00264 sub evalGreaterThan {
00265   my ($self,$a,$b) = @_; my $context = $self->context;
00266   my $I = Value::Infinity->new;
00267   return $self->Package("Interval")->new($context,'(',$b,$I,')')->with(reversed=>1) if $self->{varPos} eq 'lop';
00268   return $self->Package("Interval")->new($context,'(',-$I,$a,')')->with(reversed=>1);
00269 }
00270 
00271 sub evalLessThanOrEqualTo {
00272   my ($self,$a,$b) = @_; my $context = $self->context;
00273   my $I = Value::Infinity->new;
00274   return $self->Package("Interval")->new($context,'(',-$I,$b,']') if $self->{varPos} eq 'lop';
00275   return $self->Package("Interval")->new($context,'[',$a,$I,')');
00276 }
00277 
00278 sub evalGreaterThanOrEqualTo {
00279   my ($self,$a,$b) = @_; my $context = $self->context;
00280   my $I = Value::Infinity->new;
00281   return $self->Package("Interval")->new($context,'[',$b,$I,')')->with(reversed=>1) if $self->{varPos} eq 'lop';
00282   return $self->Package("Interval")->new($context,'(',-$I,$a,']')->with(reversed=>1);
00283 }
00284 
00285 sub evalEqualTo {
00286   my ($self,$a,$b) = @_; my $context = $self->context;
00287   my $x = ($self->{varPos} eq 'lop' ? $b : $a);
00288   return $self->Package("Set")->new($context,$x);
00289 }
00290 
00291 sub evalNotEqualTo {
00292   my ($self,$a,$b) = @_; my $context = $self->context;
00293   my $x = ($self->{varPos} eq 'lop' ? $b : $a);
00294   my $I = Value::Infinity->new;
00295   return $self->Package("Union")->new($context,
00296             $self->Package("Interval")->new($context,'(',-$I,$x,')'),
00297             $self->Package("Interval")->new($context,'(',$x,$I,')')
00298          )->with(notEqual=>1);
00299 }
00300 
00301 #
00302 #  Inequalities have dummy variables that are not really
00303 #  variables of a formula.
00304 
00305 sub getVariables {{}}
00306 
00307 #
00308 #  Avoid unwanted parentheses from the standard routines.
00309 #
00310 sub string {
00311   my ($self,$precedence) = @_;
00312   my $string; my $bop = $self->{def};
00313 
00314   $string = $self->{lop}->string($bop->{precedence}).
00315             $bop->{string}.
00316             $self->{rop}->string($bop->{precedence});
00317 
00318   return $string;
00319 }
00320 
00321 sub TeX {
00322   my ($self,$precedence) = @_;
00323   my $TeX; my $bop = $self->{def};
00324 
00325   $TeX = $self->{lop}->TeX($bop->{precedence}).
00326          (defined($bop->{TeX}) ? $bop->{TeX} : $bop->{string}) .
00327          $self->{rop}->TeX($bop->{precedence});
00328 
00329   return $TeX;
00330 }
00331 
00332 ##################################################
00333 #
00334 #  Implements the "and" operation as set intersection
00335 #
00336 package Inequalities::BOP::and;
00337 our @ISA = ("Parser::BOP");
00338 
00339 sub _check {
00340   my $self = shift;
00341   $self->Error("The operands of '%s' must be inequalities",$self->{bop})
00342     unless $self->{lop}{isInequality} && $self->{rop}{isInequality};
00343   $self->Error("Inequalities combined by '%s' must both use the same variable",$self->{bop})
00344     unless $self->{lop}{varName} eq $self->{rop}{varName};
00345   $self->{type} = Value::Type("Interval",2);
00346   $self->{varName} = $self->{lop}{varName};
00347   $self->{isInequality} = 1;
00348 }
00349 
00350 sub _eval {$_[1]->intersect($_[2])}
00351 
00352 ##################################################
00353 #
00354 #  Implements the "or" operation as set union
00355 #
00356 package Inequalities::BOP::or;
00357 our @ISA = ("Parser::BOP");
00358 
00359 sub _check {
00360   my $self = shift;
00361   $self->Error("The operands of '%s' must be inequalities",$self->{bop})
00362     unless $self->{lop}{isInequality} && $self->{rop}{isInequality};
00363   $self->Error("Inequalities combined by '%s' must both use the same variable",$self->{bop})
00364     unless $self->{lop}{varName} eq $self->{rop}{varName};
00365   $self->{type} = Value::Type("Interval",2);
00366   $self->{varName} = $self->{lop}{varName};
00367   $self->{isInequality} = 1;
00368 }
00369 
00370 sub _eval {$_[1] + $_[2]}

00372 ##################################################
00373 #
00374 #  Subclass of Parser::Variable that records whether
00375 #  this variable has already been seen in the formula
00376 #  (so that it can be removed from the formula's
00377 #  variable list when used in an inequality.)
00378 #
00379 package Inequalities::Variable;
00380 our @ISA = ("Parser::Variable");
00381 
00382 sub new {
00383   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift; my $name = shift;
00384   my $isNew = !defined $equation->{variables}{$name};
00385   my $n = $self->SUPER::new($equation,$name,@_);
00386   $n->{isNew} = $isNew;
00387   return $n;
00388 }
00389 
00390 ##################################################
00391 #
00392 #  A special class used for the variables in
00393 #  inequalities, since they are not really
00394 #  variables for the formula.  (They don't need
00395 #  to be substituted or given values when the
00396 #  formula is evaluated, and so on.)  These are
00397 #  really just placeholders, here.
00398 #
00399 package Inequalities::DummyVariable;
00400 our @ISA = ("Parser::Item");
00401 
00402 sub new {
00403   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00404   my ($equation,$name,$ref) = @_;
00405   my $def = $equation->{context}{variables}{$name};
00406   bless {name => $name, ref => $ref, def => $def, equation => $equation}, $class;
00407 }
00408 
00409 sub eval {shift};
00410 
00411 sub string {(shift)->{name}}
00412 
00413 sub TeX {
00414   my $self = shift; my $name = $self->{name};
00415   return $self->{def}{TeX} if defined $self->{def}{TeX};
00416   $name = $1.'_{'.$2.'}' if ($name =~ m/^([^_]+)_?(\d+)$/);
00417   return $name;
00418 }
00419 
00420 sub perl {
00421   my $self = shift;
00422   return $self->{def}{perl} if defined $self->{def}{perl};
00423   return '$'.$self->{name};
00424 }
00425 
00426 ##################################################
00427 #
00428 #  Give an error when U is used.
00429 #
00430 package Inequalities::BOP::union;
00431 our @ISA = ("Parser::BOP::union");
00432 
00433 sub _check {
00434   my $self = shift;
00435   $self->Error("You can't take unions of inequalities")
00436     if $self->{lop}{isInequality} || $self->{rop}{isInequality};
00437   $self->SUPER::_check(@_);
00438   $self->Error("Unions are not allowed in this context");
00439 }
00440 
00441 ##################################################
00442 #
00443 #  Don't allow sums and differences of inequalities
00444 #
00445 package Inequalities::BOP::add;
00446 our @ISA = ("Parser::BOP::add");
00447 
00448 sub _check {
00449   my $self = shift;
00450   $self->SUPER::_check(@_);
00451   $self->Error("Can't add inequalities (do you mean to use 'or'?)")
00452     if $self->{lop}{isInequality} || $self->{rop}{isInequality};
00453 }
00454 
00455 ##################################################
00456 #
00457 #  Don't allow sums and differences of inequalities
00458 #
00459 package Inequalities::BOP::subtract;
00460 our @ISA = ("Parser::BOP::subtract");
00461 
00462 sub _check {
00463   my $self = shift;
00464   $self->SUPER::_check(@_);
00465   $self->Error("Can't subtract inequalities")
00466     if $self->{lop}{isInequality} || $self->{rop}{isInequality};
00467 }

00469 ##################################################
00470 #
00471 #  For the Inequalities-Only context, report
00472 #  an error for Intervals, Sets or Union notation.
00473 #
00474 package Inequalities::List::notAllowed;
00475 our @ISA = ("Parser::List::List");
00476 
00477 sub _check {(shift)->Error("You are not allowed to use intervals or sets in this context")}

00479 #  placed in lib/Inequalities/common.pm
00480 # ##################################################
00481 # ##################################################
00482 # #
00483 # #  Subclasses of the Interval, Set, and Union classes
00484 # #  that stringify as inequalities
00485 # #
00486 # 
00487 # #
00488 # #  Some common routines to all three classes
00489 # #
00490 # package Inequalities::common;
00491 # 
00492 # #
00493 # #  Turn the object back into its usual Value version
00494 # #
00495 # sub demote {
00496 #   my $self = shift;  my $context = $self->context;
00497 #   my $other = shift; $other = $self unless defined $other;
00498 #   return $other unless Value::classMatch($other,"Inequality");
00499 #   $context->Package($other->type)->make($context,$other->makeData);
00500 # }
00501 # 
00502 # #
00503 # #  Needed to get Interval data in the right order for make(),
00504 # #  and demote all the items in a Union
00505 # #
00506 # sub makeData {(shift)->value}
00507 # 
00508 # #
00509 # #  Recursively mark Intervals and Sets in a Union as Inequalities
00510 # #
00511 # sub updateParts {}
00512 # 
00513 # #
00514 # #  Demote the operands to normal Value objects and
00515 # #  perform the action, then remake the result into
00516 # #  an Inequality again.
00517 # #
00518 # sub apply {
00519 #   my $self = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00520 #   my $method = shift;  my $other = shift;
00521 #   $context->Package("Inequality")->new($context,
00522 #     $self->demote->$method($self->demote($other),@_),
00523 #     $self->{varName});
00524 # }
00525 # 
00526 # sub add {(shift)->apply("add",@_)}
00527 # sub sub {(shift)->apply("sub",@_)}
00528 # sub reduce {(shift)->apply("reduce",@_)}
00529 # sub intersect {(shift)->apply("intersect",@_)}
00530 # 
00531 # #
00532 # #  The name to use for error messages in answer checkers
00533 # #
00534 # sub class {"Inequality"}
00535 # sub cmp_class {"an Inequality"}
00536 # sub showClass {"an Inequality"}
00537 # sub typeRef {
00538 #   my $self = shift;
00539 #   return Value::Type($self->type, $self->length, $Value::Type{number});
00540 # }
00541 # 
00542 # #
00543 # #  Get the precedence based on the type rather than the class.
00544 # #
00545 # sub precedence {
00546 #   my $self = shift; my $precedence = $self->context->{precedence};
00547 #   return $precedence->{$self->type}-$precedence->{Interval}+$precedence->{$self->class};
00548 # }
00549 # 
00550 # #
00551 # #  Produce better error messages for inequalities
00552 # #

00576 ##################################################
00577 
00578 package Inequalities::Interval;
00579 our @ISA = ("Inequalities::common", "Value::Interval");
00580 
00581 sub type {"Interval"}
00582 
00583 sub updateParts {
00584   my $self = shift;
00585   $self->{leftInfinite} = 1 if $self->{data}[0]->{isInfinite};
00586   $self->{rightInfinite} = 1 if $self->{data}[1]->{isInfinite};
00587 }
00588 
00589 sub string {
00590   my $self = shift;
00591   my ($a,$b,$open,$close) = $self->value;
00592   my $x = $self->{varName} || ($self->context->variables->names)[0];
00593   $x = $context->{variables}{$x}{string} if defined $context->{variables}{$x}{string};
00594   if ($self->{leftInfinite}) {
00595     return "-infinity < $x < infinity" if $self->{rightInfinite};
00596     return $b->string . ($close eq ')' ? ' > ' : ' >= ') . $x if $self->{reversed};
00597     return $x . ($close eq ')' ? ' < ' : ' <= ') . $b->string;
00598   } elsif ($self->{rightInfinite}) {
00599     return $x . ($open eq '(' ? ' > ' : ' >= ') . $a->string if $self->{reversed};
00600     return $a->string . ($open eq '(' ? ' < ' : ' <= ') . $x;
00601   } else {
00602     return $a->string . ($open  eq '(' ? ' < ' : ' <= ') .
00603                    $x . ($close eq ')' ? ' < ' : ' <= ') . $b->string;
00604   }
00605 }
00606 
00607 sub TeX {
00608   my $self = shift;
00609   my ($a,$b,$open,$close) = $self->value;
00610   my $context = $self->context;
00611   my $x = $self->{varName} || ($context->variables->names)[0];
00612   $x = $context->{variables}{$x}{TeX} if defined $context->{variables}{$x}{TeX};
00613   $x =~ s/^([^_]+)_?(\d+)$/$1_{$2}/;
00614   if ($self->{leftInfinite}) {
00615     return "-\\infty < $x < \\infty" if $self->{rightInfinite};
00616     return $b->TeX . ($close eq ')' ? ' > ' : ' \ge ') . $x if $self->{reversed};
00617     return $x . ($close eq ')' ? ' < ' : ' \le ') . $b->TeX;
00618   } elsif ($self->{rightInfinite}) {
00619     return $x . ($open eq '(' ? ' > ' : ' \ge ') . $a->TeX if $self->{reversed};
00620     return $a->TeX . ($open eq '(' ? ' < ' : ' \le ') . $x;
00621   } else {
00622     return $a->TeX . ($open  eq '(' ? ' < ' : ' \le ') .
00623                 $x . ($close eq ')' ? ' < ' : ' \le ') . $b->TeX;
00624   }
00625 }

00628 
00629 package Inequalities::Union;
00630 our @ISA = ("Inequalities::common", "Value::Union");
00631 
00632 sub type {"Union"}
00633 
00634 #
00635 #  Mark all the parts of the union as inequalities
00636 #
00637 sub updateParts {
00638   my $self = shift;
00639   foreach my $I (@{$self->{data}}) {
00640     $I->{varName} = $self->{varName};
00641     $I->{reduceSets} = $I->{"is".$I->type} = 1;
00642     bless $I, $self->Package("Inequality".$I->type);
00643     $I->updateParts;
00644   }
00645 }
00646 
00647 #
00648 #  Update the intervals and sets when a new union is made
00649 #
00650 sub make {
00651   my $self = (shift)->SUPER::make(@_);
00652   $self->updateParts;
00653   return $self;
00654 }
00655 
00656 #
00657 #  Demote all the items in the union
00658 #
00659 sub makeData {
00660   my $self = shift; my @U = ();
00661   foreach my $I (@{$self->{data}}) {push(@U,$I->demote)}
00662   return @U;
00663 }
00664 
00665 sub string {
00666   my $self = shift;
00667   my $equation = shift; shift; shift; my $prec = shift;
00668   return $self->display("string",$equation,$prec);
00669 }
00670 
00671 sub TeX {
00672   my $self = shift;
00673   my $equation = shift; shift; shift; my $prec = shift;
00674   return $self->display("TeX",$equation,$prec);
00675 }
00676 
00677 sub display {
00678   my $self = shift; my $method = shift; my $equation = shift; my $prec = shift;
00679   my $context = ($equation->{context} || $self->context);
00680   my $X = $self->{varName} || ($context->variables->names)[0];
00681   $X = $context->{variables}{$X}{$method} if defined $context->{variables}{$X}{$method};
00682   $X =~ s/^([^_]+)_?(\d+)$/$1_{$2}/ if $method eq 'TeX';
00683   my $op = $context->{operators}{'or'};
00684   my ($and,$or,$le,$ge,$ne,$open,$close) = @{{
00685     string => [' and ',$op->{string} || ' or ',' <= ',' >= ',' != ','(',')'],
00686     TeX =>    ['\hbox{ and }',$op->{TeX} || $op->{string} || '\hbox{ or }',
00687                ' \le ',' \ge ',' \ne ','\left(','\right)'],
00688   }->{$method}};
00689   my $showNE = $self->getFlag("showNotEquals",1);
00690   my @intervals = (); my @points = (); my $interval;
00691   foreach my $x (@{$self->data}) {
00692     $x->{format} = $self->{format} if defined $self->{format};
00693     if ($x->type eq 'Interval' && $showNE) {
00694       if (defined($interval)) {
00695     if ($interval->{data}[1] == $x->{data}[0]) {
00696       push(@points,$X.$ne.$x->{data}[0]->$method($equation));
00697       $interval = $interval->with(isCopy=>1, data=>[$interval->value]) unless $interval->{isCopy};
00698       $interval->{data}[1] = $x->{data}[1];
00699       $interval->{rightInfinite} = 1 if $x->{rightInfinite};
00700       next;
00701     }
00702     push(@intervals,$self->joinAnd($interval,$method,$and,$equation,@points));
00703       }
00704       $interval = $x; @points = (); next;
00705     }
00706     if (defined($interval)) {
00707       push(@intervals,$self->joinAnd($interval,$method,$and,$equation,@points));
00708       $interval = undef; @points = ();
00709     }
00710     push(@intervals,$x->$method($equation));
00711   }
00712   push(@intervals,$self->joinAnd($interval,$method,$and,$equation,@points)) if defined($interval);
00713   my $string = join($or,@intervals);
00714   $string = $open.$string.$close if defined($prec) && $prec > ($op->{precedence} || 1.5);
00715   return $string;
00716 }
00717 
00718 sub joinAnd {
00719   my $self = shift; $interval = shift; $method = shift, my $and = shift; my $equation = shift;
00720   unshift(@_,$interval->$method($equation)) unless $interval->{leftInfinite} && $interval->{rightInfinite};
00721   return join($and, @_);
00722 }
00723 
00724 ##################################################
00725 
00726 package Inequalities::Set;
00727 our @ISA = ("Inequalities::common", "Value::Set");
00728 
00729 sub type {"Set"}
00730 
00731 sub string {
00732   my $self = shift;  my $equation = shift;
00733   my $x = $self->{varName} || ($self->context->variables->names)[0];
00734   $x = $context->{variables}{$x}{string} if defined $context->{variables}{$x}{string};
00735   my @coords = ();
00736   foreach my $a (@{$self->data}) {
00737     if (Value::isValue($a)) {
00738       $a->{format} = $self->{format} if defined $self->{format};
00739       push(@coords,$x.' = '.$a->string($equation));
00740     } else {
00741       push(@coords,$x.' = '.$a);
00742     }
00743   }
00744   return $self->getFlag('noneWord') unless scalar(@coords);
00745   return join(" or ",@coords);
00746 }
00747 
00748 sub TeX {
00749   my $self = shift;  my $equation = shift;
00750   my $x = $self->{varName} || ($self->context->variables->names)[0];
00751   $x = $context->{variables}{$x}{TeX} if defined $context->{variables}{$x}{TeX};
00752   $x =~ s/^([^_]+)_?(\d+)$/$1_{$2}/;
00753   my @coords = ();
00754   foreach my $a (@{$self->data}) {
00755     if (Value::isValue($a)) {
00756       $a->{format} = $self->{format} if defined $self->{format};
00757       push(@coords,$x.' = '.$a->TeX($equation));
00758     } else {
00759       push(@coords,$x.' = '.$a);
00760     }
00761   }
00762   return '\hbox{'.$self->getFlag('noneWord').'}' unless scalar(@coords);
00763   return join('\hbox{ or }',@coords);
00764 }
00765 
00766 ##################################################
00767 #
00768 #  A class for making inequalities by hand
00769 #
00770 package Inequalities::Inequality;
00771 our @ISA = ('Value');
00772 
00773 sub new {
00774   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00775   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00776   my $S = shift; my $x = shift;
00777   $S = Value::makeValue($S,context=>$context);
00778   if (Value::classMatch($S,"Inequality")) {
00779     if (defined($x)) {$S->{varName} = $x; $S->updateParts}
00780     return $S;
00781   }
00782   $x = ($context->variables->names)[0] unless $x;
00783   $S = bless $S->inContext($context), $context->Package("Inequality".$S->type);
00784   $S->{varName} = $x; $S->{reduceSets} = $S->{"is".$S->Type} = 1;
00785   $S->updateParts;
00786   return $S;
00787 }
00788 
00789 ##################################################
00790 #
00791 #  Allow Interval() to coerce types to Value::Interval
00792 #
00793 package Inequalities::MakeInterval;
00794 our @ISA = ("Value::Interval");
00795 
00796 sub new {
00797   my $self = shift;
00798   $self = $self->SUPER::new(@_);
00799   $self = $self->demote if $self->classMatch("Inequality");
00800   return $self;
00801 }
00802 
00803 ##################################################
00804 #
00805 #  Mark this as a list of inequalities (if it is)
00806 #
00807 package Inequalities::List;
00808 our @ISA = ("Value::List");
00809 
00810 sub new {
00811   my $self = (shift)->SUPER::new(@_);
00812   return $self unless $self->{type} =~ m/^(unknown|Interval|Set|Union)$/;
00813   foreach my $x (@{$self->{data}}) {return $self unless Value::classMatch($x,'Inequality')}
00814   $self->{type} = 'Inequality';
00815   return $self;
00816 }
00817 
00818 package Inequalities::List::List;
00819 our @ISA = ("Parser::List::List");
00820 
00821 sub _check {
00822   my $self = shift; $self->SUPER::_check(@_);
00823   if ($self->canBeInUnion) {
00824     #
00825     #  Convert lists that look like intervals into intervals
00826     #  and then check if they are OK.
00827     #
00828     bless $self, $self->context->{lists}{Interval}{class};
00829     $self->{type} = $Value::Type{interval};
00830     $self->{parens} = $self->context->{parens}{interval};
00831     $self->_check;
00832   } else {
00833     my $entryType = $self->typeRef->{entryType};
00834     return unless $entryType->{name} =~ m/^(unknown|Interval|Set|Union)$/;
00835     foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {return unless $x->{isInequality}};
00836     $entryType->{name} = "Inequality";
00837   }
00838 }
